title: Agent Quick-Start (Cold Load)
subtitle: Edge deployment: download + instantiate + startup latency
methodology: Total cost to prepare an agent's memory engine. Sharc uses zero native dependencies, avoiding the 1.5MB WASM download penalty of SQLite. Measured: 4.0μs vs 142ms.
whyItMatters: Cold start determines how fast an AI agent can boot. At 4μs, Sharc enables instant agent activation - critical for serverless and edge deployments.

title: Schema Introspection
subtitle: Read table names, columns, constraints
methodology: Read all table definitions. Sharc walks sqlite_schema B-tree directly. Measured: 2.97μs vs SQLite 26.66μs (9.0x).
whyItMatters: Agents introspect schema to understand available data. Faster schema reads mean faster tool discovery and context construction.

title: Context Retrieval (Batch Scan)
subtitle: Full-context iteration for prompt construction
methodology: Retrieving 5K context rows for an LLM prompt. Sharc uses lazy decoding to avoid unnecessary GC pressure. Measured: 2.59ms vs 6.03ms.
whyItMatters: Prompt construction requires scanning thousands of rows. 2.3x faster scans mean agents build context in half the time.

title: Memory Seek (Direct Access)
subtitle: Pinpoint retrieval of a single fact by Primary Key
methodology: Retrieving a specific memory by its global ID. Sharc uses PreparedReader with B-tree leaf cache for zero-allocation cursor reuse. Measured: 276ns vs 30,135ns (109x).
whyItMatters: Agents retrieve specific facts by ID thousands of times per conversation. 109x faster seeks with zero GC pressure compound into massive latency savings.

title: Batch Lookups
subtitle: Consecutive seeks with page cache locality
methodology: 6 random PK lookups across B-tree with PreparedReader cursor reuse. Measured: Sharc 1,656ns vs SQLite 180,810ns (109x per seek).
whyItMatters: Multi-step reasoning requires multiple lookups per turn. 109x faster seeks with zero allocation keep agent response times imperceptible.

title: Type Decoding - Integers
subtitle: Raw decode speed for typed column values
methodology: Decode 5K integer values with PreparedReader cursor reuse. Sharc: ReadOnlySpan<byte> + struct returns. Measured: 0.161ms vs SQLite 0.819ms (5.1x).
whyItMatters: Type decoding runs millions of times during large scans. 5.1x faster decoding with zero allocation means proportionally less CPU time per query.

title: NULL Detection
subtitle: Check NULLs without full row decode
methodology: Scan 5K rows checking nullable column with PreparedReader. Sharc reads only serial type headers. Measured: 141μs vs SQLite 746μs (5.3x).
whyItMatters: NULL checks are the first filter in most queries. Header-only reads with zero allocation skip 90% of the work.
